edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models
Class Caption

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.ObservableModel
          edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.Caption

public class Caption
extends ObservableModel

The Caption class is used to insert basic textual annotations into the graph itself in order to highlight points of interest. Although not technically related to the graph's mathematical structure, when positioned alongside vertices and edges, captions can provide insight and notes into the graph's structure that might otherwise be unclear. Along with Vertexes and Edges, a list of these classes is maintained in each Graph object, and so persists through serialization and deserialization.

As an ObservableModel, this class also supports multiple subscribing Observers. Whenever a change is made to any of its properties, notification of that change is automatically propagated upwards until it hits the Graph level and triggers an Observable.notifyObservers(Object) call.

Author:
Cameron Behar
See Also:
Graph, Vertex, Edge

Method Detail

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this caption in JSON format. This method can be used to serialize a caption, which may later be deserialized using the class's string constructor. For more information on the JSON format (used throughout VisiGraph for serialization), visit here.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
this Caption serialized as a String
